item.title: Tyler add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Substitute 'damn' every time you're inclined to write 'very;' your editor will delete it and the writing will be just as it should be." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Tyler add a quote by E.B. White
item.description: "If the world were merely seductive, that would be easy. If it were merely challenging, that would be no problem. But I arise in the morning torn between a desire to improve the world and a desire to enjoy the world. This makes it hard to plan the day." -- E.B. White

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "For instance, on the planet Earth, man had always assumed that he was more intelligent than dolphins because he had achieved so much&mdash;the wheel, New York, wars and so on&mdash;whilst all the dolphins had ever done was muck about in the water having a good time. But conversely, the dolphins had always believed that they were far more intelligent than man&mdash;for precisely the same reasons." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "There is a theory which states that if ever anyone discovers exactly what the Universe is for and why it is here, it will instantly disappear and be replaced by something even more bizarre and inexplicable. There is another theory which states that this has already happened." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "I like work: it fascinates me. I can sit and look at it for hours." -- Jerome K. Jerome

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Amanda Cross
item.description: "A literary academic can no more pass a bookstore than an alcoholic can pass a bar." -- Amanda Cross

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Creativity is knowing how to hide your sources" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Disbelief in magic can force a poor soul into believing in government and business." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Steven Wright
item.description: "I put instant coffee in a microwave oven and almost went back in time." -- Steven Wright

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I refuse to answer that question on the grounds that I don't know the answer" -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Ben Elton
item.description: "This calls for a very special blend of psychology and extreme violence." -- Ben Elton

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Sometimes when I'm talking, my words can't keep up with my thoughts. I wonder why we think faster than we speak. Probably so we can think twice." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Scott Adams
item.description: "The first time you see something that you have never seen before, you almost always know right away if you should eat it or run away from it." -- Scott Adams

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Well, art is art, isn't it? Still, on the other hand, water is water! And east is east and west is west and if you take cranberries and stew them like applesauce they taste much more like prunes than rhubarb does. Now, uh... now you tell me what you know." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "When beetles fight these battles in a bottle with their paddles and the bottle's on a poodle and the poodle's eating noodles... ...they call this a muddle puddle tweetle poodle beetle noodle bottle paddle battle." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "I don't deserve any credit for turning the other cheek as my tongue is always in it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Edith Konecky
item.description: "I have a terrible memory; I never forget a thing." -- Edith Konecky

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "We're so busy watching out for what's just ahead of us that we don't take time to enjoy where we are." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Tyler add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tyler add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis
